subject: Business
title: The Series A Crunch
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Series A Crunch.

hook.text: Thousands of startups raise seed funding each year. Only a fraction survive to Series A.

buildup.text: Series A investors want proof: revenue growth, strong retention, and a clear path forward.

discovery.text: The gap between seed and Series A is the valley of death â€” money runs out before traction proves out.

twist.text: More seed funds entered the market, but Series A capacity didn't grow. The crunch widened.

climax.text: Surviving the crunch means hitting Series A milestones on a seed budget.

punchline.text: Seed money is the easy part. Earning the next round is the test.

quiz.question: What causes the 'Series A crunch'?
options: More seed-funded startups than available Series A capital
Too few startups applying for funding
